          #include <stdio.h>
          #include <stdlib.h>
          #include <string.h>
          #include <ctype.h>

          int main() {
              long long n;
              scanf("%lld", &n);

              long long l = 1;
              long long r = n;
              while (l < r) {
                  long long mid = l + (r - l) / 2;
                  long long idxcnt = mid * (mid + 1) / 2;
                  if (idxcnt < n) {
                      l = mid + 1;
                  } else {
                      r = mid;
                  }
              }
              l = l - 1;
              long long idxcnt = l * (l + 1) / 2;
              long long x = n - idxcnt;

              // Convert x to a string
              char str_x[25]; // 20 digits for 64-bit is safe, but 25 for safety.
              sprintf(str_x, "%lld", x);

              // Now process the string for the second program
              const char *punctuation = ",.!?";
              int len = strlen(str_x);
              char res[200] = {0}; // initialize to zero
              int res_index = 0;

              for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
                  if (i == 0) {
                      // If it's punctuation, skip. Otherwise, add.
                      if (strchr(punctuation, str_x[i]) != NULL) {
                          // skip
                          continue;
                      }
                      // We don't check for empty because it's not possible.
                      res[res_index++] = str_x[i];
                  } else {
                      // Check: if the current char is empty? -> skip. We don't have, so we skip the empty condition.

                      // Check if it's punctuation
                      if (strchr(punctuation, str_x[i]) != NULL) {
                          // Check if the last character in res is an empty string? 
                          // But we have stored only non-empty characters? and we represent empty by what? 
                          // We haven't stored any empty? so we skip the pop.

                          // Then we do: append the punctuation and then an empty string? 
                          // We append the punctuation as a character.
                          res[res_index++] = str_x[i];
                          // Then we would append an empty string? -> we skip because we cannot store an empty in a char array? 
                          // But the Python code appends an empty string? which in the final join becomes nothing? 
                          // So we do nothing? 
                      } else {
                          res[res_index++] = str_x[i];
                      }
                  }
              }
              res[res_index] = '\0'; // null terminate

              printf("%s\n", res);

              return 0;
          }
